Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.controller

Class ClientController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.controller.ClientController
public class ClientController
extends java.lang.Object
ClientController Class

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.util.logging.Logger loggerIO
    Public client logger, where you can print any message

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ClientController()
    ClientController Constructor: Initializes a new logger and stores the thread that the constructor invoked (so that it can be stopped) see registerControllerThread, if using multiple threads

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addPlayerRequest​(java.lang.String playerNickname, int lobbySize)
    Communicates to the server the intention to join the game,
    Nickname on the server according to the convention, (lowercase, no special char) N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
    java.lang.String getActualPlayer()  
    void getBattlefieldRequest()
    Client asks the server for Battlefield Update N.B: Blocking request until a response is received

    Getter to get the current worker who will have to make the action, N.B: It can be null, if it is not your turn

    Communicates to the server the need to get the deck N.B: Blocking request until a response is received

    Client asks the server for PlayersList Update N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
    ClientSocketConnection getSocketConnection()  
    boolean getValidNick()  
    java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getWorkersID()  
    boolean[][] getWorkerView()  
    boolean getWorkerViewCell​(int x, int y)
    Get the cell boolean in position x,y of the workerView
    void initializeNetwork()
    Initialize a new socket on the controller from which it is called, the socket is missing the host address of the server to be able to start, have a default port that can be changed.

    1) setIP: clientController.getSocketConnection().setServerName("String")
    (opt)setPort: clientController.getSocketConnection().setServerPort("int")
    2) startSocket: clientController.getSocketConnection().startConnection()
    void interruptNormalThreadExecution()
    Interrupts the controllerThread that started the controller first (or was registered later)-(controllerThread)
    boolean isFullLobby()  
    boolean isInvalidWorkerView()
    Check if the workerView is all false and therefore no action is possible
    void playStepRequest​(int row, int col)
    Client notifies the server of the action requested by the player for the current step N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
    void registerControllerThread​(java.lang.Thread controllerThread)
    If you use a different thread to invoke the functions of the controller, through this function you can register correctly so that you are interrupted in case of error

    - N.B: It is recommended to use only one thread to manage all commands to the controller
    void registerHandler​(ServerHandler serverHandler)
    Associate controller to server handler
    void resetPingTimer()
    Clear the ping timer and reset it
    void selectWorkerRequest​(int row, int col)
    Client notifies the server, with coordinates of the worker selected by the player, expecting his workerView as server response N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
    void sendPingResponse()
    Responds to the server ping message
    void setActualPlayer​(java.lang.String actualPlayer)  
    void setCardsDeck​(Deck cardsDeck)  
    void setCurrentLobbySize​(int currentLobbySize)  
    void setCurrentStep​(Step currentStep)  
    void setCurrentWorker​(SelectedWorker currentWorker)  
    void setFullLobby​(boolean fullLobby)  
    void setGameExceptionMessage​(java.lang.String errorMessage, GameState gameState, boolean interruptExecution)
    Set an error code ("string") in the exception,
    It is the easiest way to throw an exception to the client via the controller
    You can pass a null in place of the error string, to keep the default error or the previous exception

    N.B: It is recommended to use ExceptionMessages to choose error messages
    void setGameState​(GameState gameState)  
    void setGodCards​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> godCards)  
    void setGodPlayer​(java.lang.String godPlayer)  
    void setLobbyState​(boolean lobbyState)  
    void setPickedCardsRequest​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> cards)
    Communicate to the server the cards chosen by the God Player, the number of cards chosen must be equal to currentLobbySize
    void setPlayerCardRequest​(java.lang.String cardName)
    Communicate to the server the card chosen by the Player and save it in the ClientController (choice between possible cards sent by the server with the mirror command)
    void setPlayerColor​(Color playerColor)  
    void setPlayerNickname​(java.lang.String playerNickname)
    Set the nickname on the server according to the convention, lowercase
    void setPlayers​(java.util.List<PlayerInterface> players)  
    void setStartTurn​(boolean basicTurn)
    Client asks the server to start a turn, based on basicTurn decision N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
    void setUserView​(View userView)  
    void setValidNick​(boolean validNick)  
    void setWorkersID​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> workersID)  
    void setWorkersPositionRequest​(java.util.List<WorkerPositionInterface> workersPosition)
    After requesting the battlefield, with this method the client chooses where to put the workers on the board (one at a time) checking not to put it on another player
    void setWorkerView​(boolean[][] workerView)  
    void showToUserBattlefield()
    Show the battlefield to the user (regardless of the graphic interface chosen)
    void skipStepRequest()
    Client notifies the server of the choice of player to skip the current step N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
    java.util.logging.Logger start_IO_Logger​(boolean uniqueness)
    Initializes a new logger, which writes a file to the root where the jar / executable is run, The log file is unique and in TXT format, If it is impossible to create a new log file, execution continues with an error
    void waitActualPlayer()
    Wait until you receive ActualPlayer message from the server N.B: Blocking method until a response is received
    void waitSetPickedCards()
    Wait until you receive SetPickedCards message from the server N.B: Blocking method until a response is received
    void waitSetPlayerCard()
    Wait until you receive SetPlayerCard message from the server N.B: Blocking method until a response is received
    void waitSetWorkersPosition()
    Wait until you receive SetWorkersPosition message from the server N.B: Blocking method until a response is received
    void waitWorkerViewUpdate()
    Wait until you receive WorkerViewUpdate message from the server N.B: Blocking method until a response is received

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • loggerIO

      public final java.util.logging.Logger loggerIO
      Public client logger, where you can print any message

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientController

      public ClientController()
      ClientController Constructor: Initializes a new logger and stores the thread that the constructor invoked (so that it can be stopped) see registerControllerThread, if using multiple threads

  • Method Details

    • showToUserBattlefield

      public void showToUserBattlefield()
      Show the battlefield to the user (regardless of the graphic interface chosen)

    • initializeNetwork

      public void initializeNetwork()
      Initialize a new socket on the controller from which it is called, the socket is missing the host address of the server to be able to start, have a default port that can be changed.

      1) setIP: clientController.getSocketConnection().setServerName("String")
      (opt)setPort: clientController.getSocketConnection().setServerPort("int")
      2) startSocket: clientController.getSocketConnection().startConnection()

    • registerHandler

      public void registerHandler​(ServerHandler serverHandler)
      Associate controller to server handler
      Parameters:
      serverHandler - server handler

    • registerControllerThread

      public void registerControllerThread​(java.lang.Thread controllerThread)
      If you use a different thread to invoke the functions of the controller, through this function you can register correctly so that you are interrupted in case of error

      - N.B: It is recommended to use only one thread to manage all commands to the controller
      Parameters:
      controllerThread - Thread that can be stopped in case of errors

    • setGameExceptionMessage

      public void setGameExceptionMessage​(java.lang.String errorMessage, GameState gameState, boolean interruptExecution)
      Set an error code ("string") in the exception,
      It is the easiest way to throw an exception to the client via the controller
      You can pass a null in place of the error string, to keep the default error or the previous exception

      N.B: It is recommended to use ExceptionMessages to choose error messages
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - String representing the error (Recommended to take it from ExceptionMessages-class)
      gameState - State in which the game will go
      interruptExecution - If true the game will be blocked from its normal execution and will have to handle the exception

    • interruptNormalThreadExecution

      public void interruptNormalThreadExecution()
      Interrupts the controllerThread that started the controller first (or was registered later)-(controllerThread)

    • waitSetPickedCards

      public void waitSetPickedCards() throws SantoriniException
      Wait until you receive SetPickedCards message from the server N.B: Blocking method until a response is received
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • waitSetPlayerCard

      public void waitSetPlayerCard() throws SantoriniException
      Wait until you receive SetPlayerCard message from the server N.B: Blocking method until a response is received
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • waitSetWorkersPosition

      public void waitSetWorkersPosition() throws SantoriniException
      Wait until you receive SetWorkersPosition message from the server N.B: Blocking method until a response is received
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • waitActualPlayer

      public void waitActualPlayer() throws SantoriniException
      Wait until you receive ActualPlayer message from the server N.B: Blocking method until a response is received
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • waitWorkerViewUpdate

      public void waitWorkerViewUpdate() throws SantoriniException
      Wait until you receive WorkerViewUpdate message from the server N.B: Blocking method until a response is received
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • addPlayerRequest

      public void addPlayerRequest​(java.lang.String playerNickname, int lobbySize) throws SantoriniException
      Communicates to the server the intention to join the game,
      Nickname on the server according to the convention, (lowercase, no special char) N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
      Parameters:
      playerNickname - NickName Choose by the player
      lobbySize - Preferred size of the lobby
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • getDeckRequest

      public void getDeckRequest() throws SantoriniException
      Communicates to the server the need to get the deck N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • setPickedCardsRequest

      public void setPickedCardsRequest​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> cards)
      Communicate to the server the cards chosen by the God Player, the number of cards chosen must be equal to currentLobbySize
      Parameters:
      cards - list of strings, where each string is the name of the card chosen in cardsDeck

    • setPlayerCardRequest

      public void setPlayerCardRequest​(java.lang.String cardName)
      Communicate to the server the card chosen by the Player and save it in the ClientController (choice between possible cards sent by the server with the mirror command)
      Parameters:
      cardName - name of the chosen card

    • getPlayersRequest

      public void getPlayersRequest() throws SantoriniException
      Client asks the server for PlayersList Update N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • getBattlefieldRequest

      public void getBattlefieldRequest() throws SantoriniException
      Client asks the server for Battlefield Update N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • setWorkersPositionRequest

      public void setWorkersPositionRequest​(java.util.List<WorkerPositionInterface> workersPosition)
      After requesting the battlefield, with this method the client chooses where to put the workers on the board (one at a time) checking not to put it on another player
      Parameters:
      workersPosition - List containing the ID and position of each worker

    • setStartTurn

      public void setStartTurn​(boolean basicTurn) throws SantoriniException
      Client asks the server to start a turn, based on basicTurn decision N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
      Parameters:
      basicTurn - true: turn without effects, false: turn with effects from your card
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • selectWorkerRequest

      public void selectWorkerRequest​(int row, int col) throws SantoriniException
      Client notifies the server, with coordinates of the worker selected by the player, expecting his workerView as server response N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
      Parameters:
      row - selected worker battlefield row coordinate
      col - selected worker battlefield column coordinate
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • playStepRequest

      public void playStepRequest​(int row, int col) throws SantoriniException
      Client notifies the server of the action requested by the player for the current step N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
      Parameters:
      row - action battlefield row coordinate
      col - action battlefield column coordinate
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • skipStepRequest

      public void skipStepRequest() throws SantoriniException
      Client notifies the server of the choice of player to skip the current step N.B: Blocking request until a response is received
      Throws:
      SantoriniException - game general purpose exception

    • getWorkerViewCell

      public boolean getWorkerViewCell​(int x, int y)
      Get the cell boolean in position x,y of the workerView
      Parameters:
      x - workerView row
      y - workerView column
      Returns:
      Boolean associated with the cell

    • isInvalidWorkerView

      public boolean isInvalidWorkerView()
      Check if the workerView is all false and therefore no action is possible
      Returns:
      true if workerView is all false, false at least one action is possible

    • start_IO_Logger

      public java.util.logging.Logger start_IO_Logger​(boolean uniqueness)
      Initializes a new logger, which writes a file to the root where the jar / executable is run, The log file is unique and in TXT format, If it is impossible to create a new log file, execution continues with an error
      Parameters:
      uniqueness - boolean that allows you to generate always different files (true)
      Returns:
      Logger interface on which messages can be sent (info, severe etc.)

    • sendPingResponse

      public void sendPingResponse()
      Responds to the server ping message

      public void resetPingTimer()
      Clear the ping timer and reset it
